description: Within the contemporary context, humanity's place within Earth's ecological system is fraught
with ethical challenges. This course examines the Christian ethical tradition as a means to
identify ethical resources for addressing ecological problems as well as reflect on how nature
itself challenges ethical reflection. Students will investigate particular moral issues relating to
sustainability and ecological concerns. The course will cover why and how God calls Christians
to tend and sustain creation. Prerequisite: BTS-T. Counts toward religion and environmental
